item.title: Report X-2024070484
item.description:
Report X-2024070484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On june 25th a box marked as UN1266 Perfumery Products was found damaged and leaking. it is unknown how the damage to the box occurred however 3 bottles inside of the package were broken and leaked their contents. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers dec and further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024070482
item.description:
Report X-2024070482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 18th 6 packages were found that contained Dry Ice when the lid popped off of the outer package during loading for delivery. All 6 packages had no indication that they contained Dry Ice. Some of the packages had an EQ 8 label on the outside of the package. Because of the dry ice involved the packages were released to the consignee.

item.title: Report E-2024070135
item.description:
Report E-2024070135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: LA PORTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured and released approximately 53-gallons of product to the trailer interior, adjacent freight, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070310
item.description:
Report X-2024070310

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Derrick Reed City Driver called safety to report a spill in his trailer 401433 outside of a delivery location at 7754 W Morris ST Indianapolis IN 46231. Derrick stated it looks to be around 2 gallons of UN3266,CORROSIVELIQUID,BASIC, INORGANIC,N.O.S.(SODIUMHYDROXIDE),8,PGII had spilled inside the tra iler on the floor and 16oz was on the ground outside of the trailer on the concrete. Derrick stated no waterways or drains are affected by the spill. Derrick stated it appears the pallet may have shifted in transit and struck another pallet behind it causing the spill in a 5 gallon pail on the palle t. CURA was called to assist with the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024070246
item.description:
Report X-2024070246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the INDH location. The fiberboard box contained a single can of spray paint, fully released and some metal office files to keep the paint can from rolling around. Paint can label was covered with duct tape. There were no DG marking or paperwork required for transport. Package was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location
